Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Lycotoxin I (lycotoxin-1; natural AMPs; spiders, arachnids, Chelicerata, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; XXA; ZZI; VIHNN; UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against Gram-negative bacteria E. coli D31 (MIC 10-20 uM) and weakly active against yeast C. glabrata ATCC 2001; C. albicans clinical isolate (this ref). Also active against S. aureus USA300 MRSA (MIC 3.1 uM), E. coli (MIC 25 uM), B. subtilis (MIC 6.25 uM), and P. aeruginosa (MIC 6.25 uM) (Menousek J et al 2012 Int J Antimicrob Agents 39:402).This peptide also inhibits Escherichia coli ATP synthase (Azim et al., 2016).Toxicity: not hemo.lytic (MIC 125 uM).Structure:  The predicted secondary structures of the lycotoxins display amphipathic alpha-helix.Updated 5/2015; 3/2016; 12/2023; 12/2024.
Literature Information.Author: Yan L, Adams ME1998
Literature Information.Title: Lycotoxins, Antimicrobial Peptides from Venom of the Wolf Spider Lycosa carolinensis.
